msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the left and right hand sides, almost regularly cut at the top. kollesis at the left margin of the column. A break at the right side of the top of the column; lacuna at the bottom that don't affect the text very much. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated the new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the taxpayer. Some dots of ink can be seen in the upper edge of the column; a trace of ink runs against the fibers; a dot of ink on one of the payments of the lower part, on Verso as well. Some salt deposits on the upper part of the column.

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Apynchis, son of Sarapion, grandson of Euhemeros, mother Thaisas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 154)
Satabous, son of Phaesis, grandson of Sarapion, mother Philoumene (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 226)
Sisois, son of Neilos, grandson of Euhemeros, mother Taeuhemeros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 229)
Ptolemaios, son of Orsenouphis, grandson of Herieus, mother Anthia (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 218)
Artemas, son of Heron, grandson of Petheus, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 155)
Kastor the son, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 181)
Ptollas, son of Satabous, grandson of Ptollas, mother Tapontos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 221)
Petheus, son of Pasoxis, grandson of Petheus, mother Segathis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 203)
Pnepheros, son of Petaus, grandson of Pnepheros, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 213)
Petheus, son of Petheus, grandson of Onnophris, mother Taphaseis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 203)
Sempronia daughter of Isidoros (wife of Simillos) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 228)
Heron, son of Achillas, grandson of Onnophris, mother Didymarion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 171)
Teos, son of Petheus, grandson of Teos, mother Taonnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 242)
Nikephoros slave of Longinus, son of Isidorus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)
Germanos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 160)
Heraklas, bastard, mother Taonnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 167)
Horion the son, mother Demarous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 248)
Sempronios, son of Maximimian (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 228)
Sarapion, son of Sarapion, grandson of Petoraipis, mother Thatris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 225)
Sabinus, son of Anchophis, grandson of Satabous, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 222)
Isidoros, son of Apollonios, grandson of Petheus, mother Euphrosyne (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 179)
Apollos, son of Mysthes, grandson of Isidoros, mother Thases (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 153)
Phaesis, son of Pekmeis, also called Euhemeros, mother Sambathion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 246)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
